data.Name: % Sessions with CPU Queue
data.Tool tips: The portion of VDI Sessions, expressed in percentage, with CPU Queue Length > 2 per vCPU. This could indicate performance degradation

data.Name: % Sessions with CPU Ready
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: % Sessions with Disk Latency
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: % Sessions with Disk Queue
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: % Sessions with Receive Packet Loss
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: % Sessions with Transmit Packet Loss
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: CPU Usage
data.Tool tips: The session CPU consumption relative to the RDS Host size. This is not the total RDS Host usage

data.Name: 95th Percentile Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: 95th percentile Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The worst DC KPI value after removing the worst 5% values in the series. Based on all the RDS sessions and VDI sessions in the pod

data.Name: 95th Percentile Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: 95th percentile Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "95th percentile Pod Network KPI" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: Number of Pools
data.Tool tips: The number of application pools (RDS and VDI) with this application as the display name

data.Name: 95th percentile Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "95th percentile Pod Network KPI" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: 95th Percentile Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: 95th percentile Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The worst Network KPI value after removing the worst 5% values in the series. Based on all the RDS sessions and VDI sessions in the pod

data.Name: 95th percentile Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "95th percentile Pod Network KPI" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: 95th Percentile Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: 95th percentile Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "95th percentile Pod Network KPI" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: Total Utilization
data.Tool tips: Total CPU usage from all sessions, be it RDS or VDI

data.Name: Total Utilization
data.Tool tips: Total CPU usage from all sessions, be it RDS or VDI

data.Name: Worst Application Load Time
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to load an application among all sessions. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: 95th Percentile Sessions per UAG
data.Tool tips: Number of Connected Sessions per UAG, at 95th percentile, across the Horizon Pod.

data.Name: 99th Percentile Daily Session Remaining
data.Tool tips: The number of user sessions remaining, based on the last 24 hours consumption. It's calculated based on the 99th percentile to exclude the outlier, and consider Horizon RDS Host overhead

data.Name: Average Session CPU Usage
data.Tool tips: The average among all the RDS Sessions' CPU utilization. This should be well within the planned number.

data.Name: 95th Percentile Utilization
data.Tool tips: The CPU utilization of all RDS Sessions. 95th percentile is used instead of average as it's more appropriate for capacity

data.Name: 95th Percentile Utilization
data.Tool tips: The memory utilization of all RDS Sessions. 95th percentile is used instead of average as it's more appropriate for capacity

data.Name: Average Utilization
data.Tool tips: The average memory used in GB across all of the Application Sessions in the Application Pool. This should be well within the planned number.

data.Name: Access Group
data.Tool tips: Access Group with permissions to administrate a VDI Pool.

data.Name: [Pool Name] Total Connected Time
data.Tool tips: At individual pool (VDI or RDS)

data.Name: CPU Usage
data.Tool tips: The CPU utilization at the point of collection (not average of entire period). The number is based on Windows Server OS, not the underlying VM, as it's a session

data.Name: Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: The number of read + write operations per second at the point of collection (not average of entire period). Investigate if this becomes excessive. This is a value reported by Guest OS, not VM, as it's a session

data.Name: Horizon Blast Codec
data.Tool tips: The Blast Codec type being used for the current Horizon Session.

data.Name: [Pool Name] Total Connected Time
data.Tool tips: At individual pool (VDI or RDS)

data.Name: Agent Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of Horizon Agent software. Best Practice is to match the Horizon version

data.Name: Application Pools
data.Tool tips: The total number of application pools from RDS Farms and VDI Pools, regardless of status

data.Name: Application Pools
data.Tool tips: Number of application pools in the farm. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Application Pools
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Farms with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Average Session Memory Usage
data.Tool tips: The average among all the RDS Sessions' Memory utilization. This should be well within the planned number.

data.Name: Application Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Sessions (App or Desktop) with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0.

data.Name: Application Sessions with Red Network KPI
Application Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of the application software

data.Name: Available Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Memory Usage
data.Tool tips: The session memory consumption. This value is from Guest OS, not the underlying VM, as it's a session.

data.Name: Average Transmit Bandwidth utilization
data.Tool tips: The average bandwidth utilization of all active sessions. As this represents all sessions, a large change should be investigated

data.Name: Total Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total CPU Usage in Ghz of all the VMs in a VDI Pool.

data.Name: Average Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The average frame rate of all active sessions. As this is an average number, it has to remain at healthy level

data.Name: Total Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total memory used in GB across all of the VMs in the VDI Pool.

data.Name: Configured Maximum Sessions
data.Tool tips: The maximum number of sessions that the Horizon Architect plans this Farm to have

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: The total number of sessions connected at present to the RDS Farm. A user can have 1 or more sessions

data.Name: Average Sessions per Connection Server
data.Tool tips: Average Connected Sessions per Connection Server used across the Horizon Pod. This should be compared against the Connection Servers Connected Sessions Disparity metric.

data.Name: Average Utilization
data.Tool tips: The average bandwidth utilization all active sessions. As this represents all sessions, a large change should be investigated

data.Name: Worst Application Load Time
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to load an application among all sessions. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: Agent Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of Horizon Agent software on the RDS Host. Best Practice is to match the Horizon version

data.Name: Client Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of Horizon Client software. Best Practice is to match the Horizon version

data.Name: Blast Secure Gateway
data.Tool tips: Status (enabled or disable)?

data.Name: Agent Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of Horizon Agent software on the VDI desktop. Best Practice is to match the Horizon version

data.Name: Worst Context Switch
data.Tool tips: The worst CPU Context Switch among all the RDS Hosts in the farm. Ensure this is within the threshold you see during baselining exercise

data.Name: IP Address
data.Tool tips: The Network IP Address of Horizon Client. This is the internal LAN  IP address

data.Name: Run Queue
data.Tool tips: Average number of ready threads queuing in each of Guest OS CPU. A number greater than 2 for prolong period indicates CPU core bottleneck

data.Name: Application Pool Names
data.Tool tips: User Date Time stamp of application pool accessed by the User.

data.Name: Agent Unreachable
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Agent that is not reachable by Connection Server. Best Practice is to keep this number 0

data.Name: Configured CPU
data.Tool tips: The size of the RDS Farm capacity in terms of CPU resources. This is the sum of all enabled RDS Hosts.

data.Name: Agent Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of Horizon Agent software. Best Practice is to match the Horizon version. In an automated pool, there is only 1 agent version. In manual pool, there can be >1 versions

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Configured Memory
data.Tool tips: The size of the RDS Farm capacity in terms of memory resources. This is the sum of all enabled RDS Hosts

data.Name: Available Capacity
data.Tool tips: Cameron why do we need it? Use case?

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Application Pool Names
data.Tool tips: The name of the application pool that the user currently use

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: see "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accopoingly

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Sessions"

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Sessions"

data.Name: Worst Outstanding IO
data.Tool tips: The highest disk outstanding IO among all the RDS Hosts. Keep this number below best practice

data.Name: Connected Users
data.Tool tips: The total number of Horizon sessions connected at present to the Cloud Pod. A user can have 1 or more sessions

data.Name: Connected Users
data.Tool tips: See "Connected Users" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connected Users
data.Tool tips: See "Connected Users" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connected Users
data.Tool tips: See "Connected Users" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connection Disparity
data.Tool tips: The % difference of Connections compared to Horizon Pod Average Connections per Connection Server.  Disparity > 30% indicates the Connection Server has an abnormal workload and requires further analysis as to the cause.

data.Name: Connection Servers
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Connection Servers in the Pod. It counts any server regardless of operational status so it's registered with the Pod. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Connection Servers
data.Tool tips: See "Connection Servers", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connection Servers
data.Tool tips: See "Connection Servers", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connection Servers Enabled
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Connection Servers in the Pod. It counts any server regardless of operational status so it's registered with the Pod. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Name
data.Tool tips: The Remote WAN Network IP Address of Horizon Client connecting into the Horizon Enviornment.

data.Name: Connection Usage
data.Tool tips: Formula?

data.Name: Context Switch
data.Tool tips: The rate at which Operating System processes running in a CPU are loaded and deloaded. As context switch is an overhead cost, a high number will impact the application performance. The number varies per application so profile your environment to baseline the expected range.

data.Name: Co-stop
data.Tool tips: Percentage of time the VM is ready to run, but is unable to due to CPU coscheduling constraints in the underlying hypervisor. VM with less vCPU have lower co-stop value. Expect this number to be below 1% for Desktop VM

data.Name: Average Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The average frame rate of all active sessions. As this is an average number, it has to remain at healthy level

data.Name: Outstanding IO
data.Tool tips: Amount of disk Input or Output commands waiting in the queue to be executed. High IO, coupled with high latency, impacts performance. This number should be below the queue depth of the OS.

data.Name: Overlap
data.Tool tips: Percentage of time where the VM was interrupted by hypervisor as it needs to perform system services on behalf of that VM or other VMs.

data.Name: Memory Usage
data.Tool tips: The session memory consumption relative to the RDS Host size.

data.Name: CPU Usage Disparity
data.Tool tips: Disparity of Connection Server cpu usage compared to the Pod Connection Server cpu usage Average.

data.Name: CPU Usage Disparity
data.Tool tips: The % difference between the Farm average RDS Host CPU % workload and the individual RDS Host CPU % workload.  Disparity > 30% indicates the RDS host has an abnormal workload and requires further analysis as to the cause.

data.Name: CPU Usage per Connection Servers
data.Tool tips: Cameron/Fahad: capacity or performance?

data.Name: Average Transmit Bandwidth utilization
data.Tool tips: The average bandwidth utilization of all active sessions. As this represents all sessions, a large change should be investigated

data.Name: Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The Key Performance Indicator, aggregating all the performance metrics into 1 metric. This focuses on the Data Center segment of RDS Farm, as opposed to the network. Value is 0 - 100% and divided into 4 levels (Green 75 - 100%, Yellow 50 - 75%, Orange 25 - 50%, Red 0 - 25%)

data.Name: Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Configuration Error
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Desktop Agent with configuration error. Best Practice is to keep this number 0

data.Name: Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connected Sessions Disparity
data.Tool tips: The % difference of Connected Sessions compared to Horizon Pod Average Connected Sessions per UAG.  Disparity > 30% indicates the UAG has an abnormal workload and requires further analysis as to the cause.

data.Name: Data Collection Enabled
data.Tool tips: vRealize Operations data collection

data.Name: Data Collection Status
data.Tool tips: vRealize Operations data collection. Value is Success or ??

data.Name: Configured Maximum Desktops
data.Tool tips: The number of VMs that the VDI pool are designed to have. This is the highest possible number for that pool, as it includes VMs that are not usable

data.Name: Configured Minimum Desktops
data.Tool tips: Cameron please help with tool tip

data.Name: Description
data.Tool tips: Free text explaining the RDS Farm. Cameron/Fahad please add best practice of info to add in the description

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Sessions"

data.Name: Available Memory
data.Tool tips: The amount of configured memory remaining.  Total Configured Memory minus Utilized memory.

data.Name: Desktops in Bad State
data.Tool tips: See "Desktops in Bad State" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Desktops in bad state
data.Tool tips: See "Desktops in Bad State" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Desktops in Bad State
data.Tool tips: See "Desktops in Bad State" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: see "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accopoingly

data.Name: Desktops in Bad State
data.Tool tips: See "Desktops in Bad State" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Average Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol latency from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 180 ms

data.Name: Customizing
data.Tool tips: The number of desktops in the customizing process. They are not available for user consumption while in this stage

data.Name: Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Deleting
data.Tool tips: The number of desktops being deleted (in process).

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Sessions"

data.Name: Broker IP Addresses
data.Tool tips: The Network IP Address of Horizon Server brokering the connection between Horizon Client and Horizon Agent

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: The number of sessions in a pool where the user has established a desktop session, but is not currently connected.  These desktops will not be available for other users to connect to.

data.Name: Number of Sessions at Present Time?
data.Tool tips: Only the RDS Desktop session

data.Name: RDS Sessions with High Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of RDS Sessions with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) latency > 180 ms. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: RDS Sessions with High Protocol Packet Receive Loss
data.Tool tips: Count of RDS Sessions with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) packet loss > 1%. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Disconnected Users
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Users"

data.Name: Disconnected Users
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Users"

data.Name: Disconnected Users
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Users"

data.Name: Packet Loss Receive
data.Tool tips: The percentage of Horizon protocol packets that did not reach Horizon Agent or was dropped due to out of order arrival. This number directly impacts user experience

data.Name: Packet Loss Transmit
data.Tool tips: The percentage of Horizon protocol packets that did not reach Horizon Client or was dropped due to out of order arrival. This number directly impacts user experience

data.Name: Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: Sum of all RDS I/O operations per second. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters I/O operations per second. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: Transmit Bandwidth utilization
data.Tool tips: The average network bandwidth utilization in the collection period. Investigate is there is prolonged excessive usage.

data.Name: Disk Read Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all RDS Hosts disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Disk Read Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Desktops in Bad State
data.Tool tips: Sum of all desktops in the pool that is not is ready or used state. Desktops that have problem. Should be 0 most of the time

data.Name: Disk Read Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The frequency of screen frame change per second. Higher refresh rates results in smoother visual but it requires more bandwidth

data.Name: Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of Disk Throughput of all RDS Hosts in the farm

data.Name: Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Desktops Machine Error State
data.Tool tips: It does not seem to be useful

data.Name: Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Latency
data.Tool tips: The time taken for Horizon protocol packets to reach destination. While related, it is not the same with protocol (e.g. TCP/IP) latency. It's a normalized average of transmit and receive packets

data.Name: Disable in Progress
data.Tool tips: The number of desktops being disabled (in process). A disabled desktop is not usable.

data.Name: Last Session Duration
data.Tool tips: The time duration of the session. The value goes up by 5 every 5 minutes if user is connected

data.Name: Disk Write Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Disk Write Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Disabled
data.Tool tips: The number of disabled desktop. Best practice is to keep this number low

data.Name: Disk Write Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Disabled Agents Error
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Desktop with disabled agent. Investigate why this happen as agent is required by Horizon

data.Name: Disconnected Desktop
data.Tool tips: Use Case? Cameron?

data.Name: Enabled
data.Tool tips: What does it mean. It returns true

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: The number of sessions in a pool where the user has established a desktop session, but is not currently connected.  These desktops will not be available for other users to connect to.

data.Name: Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: Sum of all VDI Pools I/O operations per second. It includes both Reads and Writes

data.Name: Farm or Pool with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Pools with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Farm or Pool with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Pools with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Farm Type
data.Tool tips: Manual, Automated

data.Name: Farms with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Farms with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Farms with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Farms with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Session Status
data.Tool tips: Possible values: connected, disconnected

data.Name: Free Memory
data.Tool tips: The amount of free memory available. This maps to Windows Available memory counter.

data.Name: Free Memory
data.Tool tips: The total memory used in GB across all of the VMs in the VDI Pool.

data.Name: Global Entitlement
data.Tool tips: Displays the Cloud Pod Global Entitlement pool name if the pool is a part of Global Pool, otherwise the value will be NIL.

data.Name: Global Entitlement
data.Tool tips: Needed only if Pool can be local while farm is global, vice versa

data.Name: Disk Read IOPS
data.Tool tips: Sum of all VDI Pools I/O operations per second. It includes only Read operations.

data.Name: Time taken to Load Profile
data.Tool tips: See "Time taken to load profile", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Agent Version
data.Tool tips: The version number of Horizon Agent software. Best Practice is to match the Horizon version. In an automated pool, there is only 1 agent version. In manual farm, there can be >1 versions

data.Name: Disk Read Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all VDI Pools I/O operations per second. It includes only Write operations.

data.Name: Time taken to Logon
data.Tool tips: See "Time taken to logon", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Additional Desktops based On CPU
data.Tool tips: Cluster CPU Available / Pool CPU Avg Profile. The number of potential desktops that can be added in the pool at present, taking into account cluster actual capacity

data.Name: Total Connected Time
data.Tool tips: The total time a user remains connected to a Horizon Session. The value goes up by 5 every 5 minutes

data.Name: Total Capacity (GB)
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all VDI Pools disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes.

data.Name: Disk Write IOPS
data.Tool tips: Sum of all VDI Pools disk throughput. It includes only Reads.

data.Name: Configured Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Contention (%)
data.Tool tips: The amount of time, in percentage, the VM CPU is waiting for memory to be brought in. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Connected Sessions
data.Tool tips: see "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Lowest Available Memory
data.Tool tips: Lowest Available Memory across all VDI Sessions of the user. Keep this number above 0.5 GB

data.Name: Disk Write Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all VDI Pools disk throughput. It includes only Writes.

data.Name: Context Switch
data.Tool tips: The rate at which Operating System processes running in a CPU are loaded and deloaded. As context switch is an overhead cost, a high number will impact the application performance. The number varies per application so profile your environment to baseline the expected range.

data.Name: Co-stop
data.Tool tips: Percentage of time the VM is ready to run, but is unable to due to CPU coscheduling constraints in the underlying hypervisor. VM with less vCPU have lower co-stop value. Expect this number to be below 1% for Desktop VM

data.Name: CPU Footprint
data.Tool tips: The total footprint of a user for CPU resources. Compare this number with the planned number of CPU Ghz per user. If reality is higher than plan, consider adjusting your plan

data.Name: LDAP Replication Servers in error state
data.Tool tips: What is this? What are the use case

data.Name: Disconnected Sessions
data.Tool tips: See "Disconnected Sessions"

data.Name: Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: The number of read + write operations per second. Investigate if this becomes excessive. This is a value reported by the VM, not Guest OS

data.Name: Disk Read Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: The network bandwidth consumption of read and write commands. Investigate if this becomes excessive. If this number is high at low IOPS, that indicates present of large block size

data.Name: Domain Failure Error
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Desktop with domain joining failure. Investigate why this happen

data.Name: Disk Write Throughput
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters disk throughput. It includes both Reads and Writes. Investigate if this becomes excessive

data.Name: Enabled
data.Tool tips: Why do we need both? What's the use case for each?

data.Name: Lowest Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The lowest number among all the active sessions frame rate counters. A low frame rate result in inferior user experience. Used this to track if any of the session is running on low frame rate. While occasional low is fine, a prolonged low could lead to degraded user experience

data.Name: Highest Utilized Memory
data.Tool tips: Highest Utilized Memory across all VDI Sessions of the user.

data.Name: Error
data.Tool tips: The number of desktop with error. Investigate the reason behind it.

data.Name: Lowest Free Memory among RDS Hosts
data.Tool tips: Lowest Available Memory across all VDI Sessions of the user. Keep this number above 0.5 GB

data.Name: Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The frequency of screen frame change per second. Higher refresh rates results in smoother visual but it requires more bandwidth

data.Name: Max Recorded Number of Connections
data.Tool tips: Daily max? Why do we need this?

data.Name: Additional Desktops based On Memory
data.Tool tips: Cluster RAM Available / Pool RAM Avg Profile. The number of potential desktops that can be added in the pool at present, taking into account cluster actual capacity

data.Name: Additional Desktops Possible
data.Tool tips: The number of potential desktops that can be added in the pool at present, taking into account cluster actual capacity. Based on the lowest of CPU and memory.

data.Name: CPU Average Profile
data.Tool tips: The average CPU utilization from all connected sessions

data.Name: Memory Contention
data.Tool tips: The amount of time, in percentage, the VM CPU is waiting for memory to be brought in. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Desktop CPU Size
data.Tool tips: The size of a VDI VM in terms of CPU resources. This is only applicable for automated pool

data.Name: Memory Footprint
data.Tool tips: The total footprint of a user for memory resources. Compare this number with the planned number of Memory GB per user. If reality is higher than plan, consider adjusting your plan

data.Name: Highest CPU Usage
data.Tool tips: Total Disk Throughput (Read + Write) from all sessions, as reported by Guest OS (not VM). Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Memory Usage Disparity
data.Tool tips: Disparity of Connection Server memory usage compared to the Pod Connection Server memory usage Average.

data.Name: Memory Usage Disparity
data.Tool tips: The % difference between the Farm average RDS Host Memory workload and the individual RDS Host Memory workload. Disparity > 30 % indicates the RDS host has an abnormal workload and requires further analysis as to the cause.

data.Name: Memory Usage per Connection Servers
data.Tool tips: Cameron/Fahad: capacity or performance?

data.Name: Horizon Blast Codec
data.Tool tips: The Blast Codec type being used by the Horizon sessions

data.Name: Horizon Protocol
data.Tool tips: The protocol type being used BLAST or PCoIP

data.Name: Horizon Protocol
data.Tool tips: The protocol type being used BLAST or PCoIP

data.Name: Horizon Blast Codec
data.Tool tips: The Blast Codec type being used by the Horizon sessions

data.Name: Names of Clusters
data.Tool tips: Fahad, what is the purpose?

data.Name: In Progress
data.Tool tips: A desktop agent status of In Progress indicates that the desktop is being created, but it is not ready for use.  If a single desktop or larger number of desktops remain in this state this can indicate an issue with the destop image or Horizon environment.

data.Name: Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: Invalid IP Error
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Desktop with invalid IP address. Indicates networking issue preventing desktops from receiving valid IP, possibly DHCP or networking configuration related.

data.Name: Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: IP Address
data.Tool tips: The Remote WAN Network IP Address of Horizon Client connecting into the Horizon Enviornment.

data.Name: Number of Connections
data.Tool tips: see "Connected Sessions" for template/sample, and adjust accopoingly

data.Name: Desktop Memory Size
data.Tool tips: The size of a VDI VM in terms of CPU resources. This is only applicable for automated pool

data.Name: RDS Sessions with High Protocol Packet Transmit Loss
data.Tool tips: Count of RDS Sessions with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) packet loss > 1%. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Operating Systems
data.Tool tips: The Windows Server OS version of the RDS Host.

data.Name: Last Provisioning Error
data.Tool tips: The actual error description?

data.Name: IP Addresses
data.Tool tips: The Network IP Address of Horizon Client. This is the internal LAN  IP address

data.Name: Golden Image
data.Tool tips: Full path description of the golden image being used for the Desktop Pool.

data.Name: Last Session Duration
data.Tool tips: The time duration of the session. The value goes up by 5 every 5 minutes if user is connected

data.Name: Image State
data.Tool tips: The state of the current desktop image after pool creation or edit operation.  Values include (Published, Unpublishing, Unpublish Failed)

data.Name: Latency
data.Tool tips: The time taken for Horizon protocol packets to reach destination. While related, it is not the same with protocol (e.g. TCP/IP) latency. It's a normalized average of transmit and receive packets

data.Name: Login Timestamp
data.Tool tips: The actual time the user logged in to Windows/Linux. This covers both RDS and VDI sessions. Used for historical reporting on the User object.

data.Name: Login Timestamp
data.Tool tips: The actual time the user logged in to Windows/Linux. This covers both RDS and VDI sessions. Used for historical reporting on the User object.

data.Name: Logout Timestamp
data.Tool tips: The actual time the user logged out from Windows or Linux. Used in conjunction with Login Time to determine to determine total Session time.

data.Name: Logout Timestamp
data.Tool tips: The actual time the user logged out from Windows or Linux. Used in conjunction with Login Time to determine to determine total Session time.

data.Name: Page In Rate
data.Tool tips: The rate at which memory pages are paged in. An unexpected high value could indicate Guest OS does not have enough cache. This can cause performance problem for memory intensive application

data.Name: Parent Farm
data.Tool tips: The RDS Farm where the Application Pool is a part of

data.Name: Peak CPU Utilization among RDS Hosts (%)
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Utilization among RDS Hosts in the farm

data.Name: Queue
data.Tool tips: The number of outstanding IO requests + the IO currently being processed, as reported by Microsoft Windows

data.Name: Lowest Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The lowest number among all the active sessions frame rate counters. A low frame rate result in inferior user experience. Used this to track if any of the session is running on low frame rate. While occasional low is fine, a prolonged low could lead to degraded user experience

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The tool tip does not make sense

data.Name: Worst Memory Contention
data.Tool tips: Highest Memory Contention from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Worst Memory Page In Rate
data.Tool tips: Highest Memory page-in rate from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently

data.Name: Physical Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters configured capacity. This is raw, total capacity, and not usable capacity (which excludes buffer)

data.Name: Physical Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters configured capacity. This is raw, total capacity, and not usable capacity (which excludes buffer)

data.Name: Pods
data.Tool tips: The present number of pods in the Cloud Pod. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Pods
data.Tool tips: See "Pods"

data.Name: Pods
data.Tool tips: See "Pods"

data.Name: Pods with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of Pod with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Pods with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of Pod with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Pool ID
data.Tool tips: The unique identification of the RDS Application Pool.  This identifies which Application Pool is associated with a given Application Session.

data.Name: Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Network KPI"

data.Name: OS Types
data.Tool tips: The Operating Systems of the device where Horizon Client is running. If the user uses >1 client, this will show multiple values

data.Name: Pool Name
data.Tool tips: The displayed name of the Application Pool to the end user.

data.Name: Lowest Available Desktop
data.Tool tips: Lowest number of available desktops in the last 24 hours.  Can be used to determine if the configured pool desktop capacity is sufficient.

data.Name: Protocol Type
data.Tool tips: The type of Horizon protocol, such as PCoIP and Blast. Each protocol has their own characteristics

data.Name: Lowest Available Memory
data.Tool tips: The lowest number among all the VDI Sessions Available Memory counters. Used this to track if any of the RDS Host is running low on memory. While occasional low is fine, a prolonged low indicates capacity shortage

data.Name: Lowest Frame Rate
data.Tool tips: The lowest number among all the active sessions frame rate counters. A low frame rate result in inferior user experience. Used this to track if any of the session is running on low frame rate. While occasional low is fine, a prolonged low could lead to degraded user experience

data.Name: Provisioning Enabled
data.Tool tips: Needed only if Pool can be disabled while farm is enabled

data.Name: Maintenance Mode
data.Tool tips: The number of desktop in maintenance mode. Best practice is to keep this number low

data.Name: Outstanding IO
data.Tool tips: Amount of disk Input or Output commands waiting in the queue to be executed. High IO, coupled with high latency, impacts performance. This number should be below the queue depth of the OS.

data.Name: Queue
data.Tool tips: The rate at which Operating System processes running in a CPU are loaded and deloaded. As context switch is an overhead cost, a high number will impact the application performance. The number varies per application so profile your environment to baseline the expected range.

data.Name: Overlap
data.Tool tips: Percentage of time where the VM was interrupted by hypervisor as it needs to perform system services on behalf of that VM or other VMs.

data.Name: Run Queue
data.Tool tips: The number of ready threads queuing in Guest OS CPU. A number greater than 2 for prolong period indicates CPU core bottleneck

data.Name: Packet Loss Receive
data.Tool tips: The percentage of Horizon protocol packets that did not reach Horizon Agent or was dropped due to out of order arrival. This number directly impacts user experience

data.Name: Packet Loss Transmit
data.Tool tips: The percentage of Horizon protocol packets that did not reach Horizon Client or was dropped due to out of order arrival. This number directly impacts user experience

data.Name: RDS Farms
data.Tool tips: See "RDS Farms"

data.Name: RDS Farms
data.Tool tips: The present number of RDS Farms in the Site. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: RDS Farms
data.Tool tips: See "RDS Farms"

data.Name: RDS Host Session Disparity
data.Tool tips: The % difference of RDS Host session count against the RDS Farms "RDS Sessions per Host" average. Disparity > 30% indicates the RDS host has an abnormal workload and requires further analysis as to the cause.

data.Name: RDS Hosts
data.Tool tips: See "RDS Hosts"

data.Name: RDS Hosts
data.Tool tips: See "RDS Hosts"

data.Name: RDS Hosts
data.Tool tips: The present number of RDS Hosts in the Site. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: RDS Hosts
data.Tool tips: See "RDS Hosts"

data.Name: RDS Hosts with High CPU Utilization
data.Tool tips: Count of RDS Hosts with CPU Usage > 95%. Expect this number to be minimal. Note that high performance typically requires high utilization

data.Name: RDS Hosts with High Disk Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of RDS Hosts with Disk Latency > 15 ms. Expect this number to be minimal, especially on SSD-backed storage

data.Name: RDS Hosts with Low Available Memory
data.Tool tips: Count of RDS Hosts with Available Memory < 500 MB. Expect this number to be minimal for ideal performance

data.Name: RDS Hosts with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Host with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: DNS Name
data.Tool tips: DNS name of who? Client or Assigned desktop from VDI pool? Why is it important?

data.Name: Peak vCPU Ready
data.Tool tips: The highest CPU Ready among the virtual CPU of the VM in any 20-second block. Aim for this number below 2.5% for good user experience

data.Name: RDS Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Sessions (App or Desktop) with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: RDS Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Sessions (App or Desktop) with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0.

data.Name: RDS Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of RDS Sessions (App or Desktop) with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0.

data.Name: Sessions per RDS Host
data.Tool tips: The average number of sessions per host in the farm. Compare this with the plan. If the reality differs with the plan, adjust accordingly

data.Name: Sessions Remaining at Present Time
data.Tool tips: The number of user sessions remaining right now. It's simply based on the current consumption, not considering historical utilization. It considers Horizon RDS Host overhead

data.Name: Maximum Desktops Used
data.Tool tips: Maximum number of concurrent desktops in use in a 30 day period.  Can be compared against the Lowest Available Desktops count to determine if the configured pool desktop capacity is sufficient.

data.Name: Peak vCPU Usage
data.Tool tips: The highest CPU utiilisation among the virtual CPU of the VM. An occasional high number is expected, but a prolonged high number coupled with CPU Run Queue and Context Switch can result in degraded user experience

data.Name: Peak vDisk Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest read or write latency among any of the VM virtual disks

data.Name: DNS Name
data.Tool tips: The DNS name of assigned desktop from VDI pool.

data.Name: Memory Average Profile
data.Tool tips: The average memory utilization from all connected sessions. The number is based on Guest OS memory utilization

data.Name: Names of Datastores
data.Tool tips: Why do we need this?

data.Name: Network KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Data Center KPI" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions (both RDS & VDI) with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) latency > 180 ms. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions (both RDS & VDI) with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) latency > 180 ms. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Operating Systems
data.Tool tips: The Desktop OS provided by the VDI Pool. This is only applicable for automated pool. Manual pool can have multiple OS

data.Name: Oversized Users
data.Tool tips: Cameron, need formula. Do we calculate 5 minute or daily? Also, what's the threshold for oversized?

data.Name: Protocol Failure Error
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Desktop with Horizon network protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) problem. Investigate why this happen as protocol is required by Horizon

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Packet Loss Received
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions (both RDS & VDI) with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) packet loss > 1%. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Packet Loss Received
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions (both RDS & VDI) with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) packet loss > 1%. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Packet Loss Transmit
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions (both RDS & VDI) with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) packet loss > 1%. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Packet Loss Transmit
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions (both RDS & VDI) with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) packet loss > 1%. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Protocol Type
data.Tool tips: The type of Horizon protocol, such as PCoIP and Blast. Each protocol has their own characteristics

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Total number of desktop session (as opposed to application session) in the farm. This includes both connected and disconnected sessions

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions connected + disconnected. This includes both application session and desktop session

data.Name: Sites
data.Tool tips: The present number of Horizon Sites in the inventory. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Provisioned
data.Tool tips: A desktop agent status of provisioned indicates that the desktop has been created, but it is not ready for use.  If a single desktop or larger number of desktops remain in this state this can indicate an issue with the destop image or Horizon environment.

data.Name: Provisioning Enabled
data.Tool tips: Why do we need both? What's the use case for each?

data.Name: State
data.Tool tips: Fahad, what is the possible states?

data.Name: Status
data.Tool tips: What does it mean. It returns OK.

data.Name: Status
data.Tool tips: Status of the application pool. Investigate if it's not enabled as that means it's not available for user consumption.

data.Name: Queue
data.Tool tips: The number of outstanding IO requests + the IO currently being processed, as reported by Microsoft Windows

data.Name: Status
data.Tool tips: Status of the RDS Farm. Investigate if it's not enabled as that means it's not available for user consumption.

data.Name: Provisioning Error
data.Tool tips: how is it used?

data.Name: RDS Desktop Pool Names
data.Tool tips: User Date Time stamp of RDS Desktop Pool for RDS Desktop Session.

data.Name: RDS Server DNS Names
data.Tool tips: User date timestamp DNS name of assigned RDS host for App Session

data.Name: RDS Server DNS Names
data.Tool tips: User date timestamp DNS name of assigned RDS host for RDS Desktop Session

data.Name: Run Queue
data.Tool tips: The number of ready threads queuing in Guest OS CPU. A number greater than 2 for prolong period indicates CPU core bottleneck

data.Name: Total Transmit Bandwidth utilization
data.Tool tips: The sum of all Farms + Pools bandwidth utilization. Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Reboot Required Error
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon Desktop that requires reboot. Reboot the Desktop to address the issue

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Configured Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Sessions with High CPU Utilization
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions where CPU Usage > 95%. Expect this number to be minimal. Note that high performance typically requires high utilization

data.Name: Sessions with High Disk Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Disk Latency > 15 ms. Expect this number to be minimal, especially on SSD-backed storage

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere Clusters capacity that are part of Horizon. This is physical, configured capacity

data.Name: Session Status
data.Tool tips: Possible values: connected, disconnected

data.Name: Time taken to Load Profile
data.Tool tips: See "Time taken to load profile", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Time taken to Logon
data.Tool tips: The total time it took for user to log in to the desktop. Investigate if this number is longer than plan as it impacts the user experience.

data.Name: Total Connected Time
data.Tool tips: The total time a user remains connected to a Horizon Session. The value goes up by 5 every 5 minutes

data.Name: Total Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: Total Read + Write IO operations from all sessions, as reported by Guest OS (not VM). Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Total Disk IOPS
data.Tool tips: Total Read + Write IO operations from all sessions. Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Sessions with High Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Horizon protocol (e.g. Blast, PCoIP) latency > 180 ms. Expect this number to be low. In ideal state it is 0

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions connected + disconnected. Used for understanding the number of sessions currently reserving or actively consuming Horizon resources.

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions connected + disconnected. Used for understanding the number of sessions currently reserving or actively consuming Horizon resources.

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions connected + disconnected. Used for understanding the number of sessions currently reserving or actively consuming Horizon resources.

data.Name: Total Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: Total Disk Throughput (Read + Write) from all sessions, as reported by Guest OS (not VM). Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions connected + disconnected. Used for understanding the number of sessions currently reserving or actively consuming Horizon resources.

data.Name: Sessions with Low Available Memory
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Available Memory < 500 MB. Expect this number to be minimal for ideal performance

data.Name: Sessions with Memory Contention
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: Sessions with Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: See "% Session with CPU Queue Length" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: Snapshot Path
data.Tool tips: Full path description of the snapshot being used for the Desktop Pool

data.Name: Total Disk Throughput
data.Tool tips: Total Disk Throughput (Read + Write) from all sessions. Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Total Sessions
data.Tool tips: Count of Sessions connected + disconnected. Used for understanding the number of sessions currently reserving or actively consuming Horizon resources.

data.Name: Spare Desktops
data.Tool tips: Cameron please help with tool tip

data.Name: UAG Servers
data.Tool tips: The present number of Universal Access Gateway in the inventory. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Startup In Progress
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI desktops starting up and reaching the available state. This should be close to 0, otherwise it could indicate a pool availability issue.

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: The total configured size of the VDI Pool capacity in terms of memory resources. This includes desktops that are not available

data.Name: Total Capacity
data.Tool tips: The total configured size of the VDI Pool capacity in terms of memory resources. This includes desktops that are not available

data.Name: Transmit Bandwidth utilization
data.Tool tips: The average network bandwidth utilization in the collection period. Investigate is there is prolonged excessive usage.

data.Name: Total Transmit Bandwidth utilization
data.Tool tips: The sum of all VDI sessions bandwidth utilization. Compare this with plan. If the reality is higher than plan, then you may run into capacity problem

data.Name: Type
data.Tool tips: Manual or Automated

data.Name: Unassigned User Connected
data.Tool tips: The number of unassigned users connected to the pool. Investigate why this happen as only assigned users should be connected

data.Name: Users
data.Tool tips: See "Users"

data.Name: Users
data.Tool tips:
The total number of unique users, active and inactive.  If a user has >1 session, count as 1 only. A user with 1 VDI session + 5 app session should be counted as 1. 
This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Users
data.Tool tips: See "Users"

data.Name: Usage (%)
data.Tool tips: The CPU utilization. The number is based on the underlying VM, not Guest OS.

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total CPU Usage in Ghz of all the VMs in a VDI Pool.

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total memory used in GB across all of the VMs in the VDI Pool.

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: Utilization as reported by VM, not Windows.

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total memory used in GB across all of the VMs in the VDI Pool.

data.Name: Unassigned User Disconnected
data.Tool tips: The number of unassigned users who disconnected from the pool. They should not be connected in the first place

data.Name: Undersized Users
data.Tool tips: Cameron, need formula. Do we calculate 5 minute or daily?

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters CPU utilization.

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: Sum of all vSphere clusters memory utilization.

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total CPU Usage in Ghz of all the VMs in a VDI Pool.

data.Name: Machine MOID
data.Tool tips: The Managed Object Identification of assigned desktop from VDI pool.

data.Name: VDI Machines
data.Tool tips: See "VDI Virtual Machines", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: VDI Machines
data.Tool tips: See "VDI Virtual Machines", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: VDI Machines
data.Tool tips: The present number of VDI Virtual Machines in the inventory. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: VDI Desktop Pool Names
data.Tool tips: The VDI pool that the user currently use

data.Name: VDI Pools
data.Tool tips: The present number of VDI Pools in the Cloud Pod. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: VDI Pools
data.Tool tips: See "VDI Pools", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: VDI Pools
data.Tool tips: See "VDI Pools", and adjust accordingly

data.Name: VDI Pools
data.Tool tips: See "VDI Pools"

data.Name: VDI Pools with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Pools with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: VDI Pools with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Pools with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: VDI Sessions with High CPU Utilization
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions where CPU Usage > 95%. Expect this number to be minimal. Note that high performance typically requires high utilization

data.Name: VDI Sessions with High CPU Utilization
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions where CPU Usage > 95%. Expect this number to be minimal. Note that high performance typically requires high utilization

data.Name: VDI Sessions with High Disk Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Disk Latency > 15 ms. Expect this number to be minimal, especially on SSD-backed storage

data.Name: VDI Sessions with High Disk Latency
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Disk Latency > 15 ms. Expect this number to be minimal, especially on SSD-backed storage

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Low Available Memory
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Available Memory < 500 MB. Expect this number to be minimal for ideal performance

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Low Available Memory
data.Tool tips: Count of VDI Sessions with Available Memory < 500 MB. Expect this number to be minimal for ideal performance

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Sessions with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Sessions with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Unknown
data.Tool tips: The number of desktop with unknown error. Investigate the reason behind it.

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Sessions with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Sessions with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Usable Capacity
data.Tool tips: Total number of desktops minus desktops in bad state, expressed as percentage of total desktops. Usable includes both available and used desktops

data.Name: VDI Virtual Machines
data.Tool tips: The present number of VDI Virtual Machines in the Pod. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: vSphere Clusters
data.Tool tips: The present number of vSphere clusters in the pod, including the management clusters & NSX Edge cluster. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Usable Desktops
data.Tool tips: Cameron please help with tool tip

data.Name: vSphere Clusters
data.Tool tips: The present number of unique vSphere clusters in the inventory.

data.Name: vSphere Datastores
data.Tool tips: The present number of vSphere datastores in the inventory that are associated with Horizon, be it shared or local datastores. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: vSphere Datastores
data.Tool tips: The present number of vSphere datastores in the pod that are associated with Horizon, be it shared or local datastores. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Usable Desktops
data.Tool tips: Cameron please help with tool tip

data.Name: Used
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI desktops in used. Best Practice is to keep this number below the capacity

data.Name: Used Capacity
data.Tool tips: The percentage of desktops in a VDI Pool that are considered in use out of the total number of desktops.  If Capacity Used = 100%, no additional desktops are available.

data.Name: User Assignment
data.Tool tips: What's the use case?

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total CPU Usage from all the VMs in a VDI Pool where there are connected sessions

data.Name: Utilization
data.Tool tips: The total memory used from all of the VMs in the VDI Pool where there are connected sessions

data.Name: Worst CPU Co-stop
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Co-stop from all RDS Hosts. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Red Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Sessions with Data Center KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: VDI Machine DNS Names
data.Tool tips: DNS name of assigned desktop from VDI pool.

data.Name: Worst CPU Co-stop
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Co-stop from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: Worst CPU Queue
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Queue from all RDS Hosts. Keep this number below 3 queue per vCPU

data.Name: Worst CPU IO Wait
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU IO Wait from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: VDI Sessions with Red Network KPI
data.Tool tips: The number of VDI Sessions with Network KPI value falls within the red range (0% - 25%). Expect this number to be 0

data.Name: Worst CPU Ready
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Ready from all RDS Hosts. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: vSphere Clusters
data.Tool tips: The present number of vSphere clusters in the pod, including the management clusters & NSX Edge cluster. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Worst CPU Overlap
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Co-stop from all VDI sessions. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: Worst Data Center KPI among RDS Hosts
data.Tool tips: Lowest Data Center KPI from all active RDS Hosts. Aim for this number to be in the green range (75% - 100%)

data.Name: Waiting for Agent
data.Tool tips: The number of desktops waiting for Horizon Agent to report. This should be 0. If not, it should be temporarily

data.Name: Worst Disk Queue
data.Tool tips: Highest Microsoft Windows Disk Queue from all active RDS Hosts. The queue length indicates the number of IO that are not yet processed

data.Name: Worst CPU Queue
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Run Queue from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 3 queue per vCPU

data.Name: Worst Context Switch
data.Tool tips: The worst CPU Context Switch among all the RDS Hosts in the farm. Ensure this is within the threshold you see during baselining exercise

data.Name: Worst Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: Lowest Data Center KPI from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Aim for this number to be in the green range (75% - 100%)

data.Name: Worst Memory Contention
data.Tool tips: Highest Memory Contention from all RDS Hosts. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Worst Disk Queue
data.Tool tips: Highest Disk Queue at Microsoft Windows. From all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently

data.Name: Worst CPU Co-stop
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Co-stop from all VDI sessions. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: Worst Memory Page In Rate
data.Tool tips: Highest Memory page-in rate from all active RDS Hosts

data.Name: Worst KPI
data.Tool tips: Worst value of VDI Session and RDS Session, where VDI Session = Average (Data Center KPI + Network KPI)

data.Name: Worst CPU Queue
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Queue from all active VDI sessions. Keep this number below 3 queue per vCPU

data.Name: Worst Network KPI among Sessions
data.Tool tips: The lowest number among all the RDS Session Network KPI metrics. Used this to track if any of the session has poor network performance.

data.Name: Worst CPU Ready
data.Tool tips: Highest CPU Ready from all VDI Sessions. Keep this number below 2.5%

data.Name: Guest OS Version
data.Tool tips: The Windows OS reported guest OS version.

data.Name: Worst Data Center KPI among Sessions
data.Tool tips: Lowest Data Center KPI from all active VDI sessions. Aim for this number to be in the green range (75% - 100%)

data.Name: Guest OS Build
data.Tool tips: The Windows OS reported guest OS build number.

data.Name: Total Connected Time
data.Tool tips: The total time a user remains connected across Horizon sessions.

data.Name: Worst Disk Queue
data.Tool tips: Highest Microsoft Windows Disk Queue from all active VDI Sessions. The queue length indicates the number of IO that are not yet processed

data.Name: Worst Network KPI
data.Tool tips: Lowest Network KPI from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Aim for this number to be in the green range (75% - 100%)

data.Name: Worst Outstanding IO
data.Tool tips: Highest disk outstanding IO from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Aim for this number to be below the underlying datastore disk queue length

data.Name: Worst Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol latency from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 180 ms

data.Name: Worst Packet Loss Received
data.Tool tips: Highest transmitted packet loss from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Worst Memory Contention
data.Tool tips: Highest Memory Contention from all VDI Sessions. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Worst Protocol Receive Packet Loss
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol Received Packet Loss from all active sessions. Keep this number below….?

data.Name: Worst Memory Page In Rate
data.Tool tips: Highest Memory page-in rate from all active VDI sessions

data.Name: Worst Protocol Transmit Packet Loss
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol Transmitted Packet Loss from all active sessions. Keep this number below….?

data.Name: Worst Network KPI among Sessions
data.Tool tips: The lowest number among all the RDS Session Network KPI metrics. Used this to track if any of the session has poor network performance.

data.Name: Worst time taken to load profile
data.Tool tips: See "Worst time taken to load profile"

data.Name: Worst time taken to load profile
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to load user profile among all users in the farm. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: Worst Packet Loss Transmit
data.Tool tips: Highest transmitted packet loss from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 1%

data.Name: Worst Outstanding IO
data.Tool tips: The highest disk outstanding IO among all the VDI sessions. Keep this number below best practice

data.Name: Worst time taken to Logon
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to login to the desktop among all users in the Pod. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: Worst Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol latency from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 180 ms

data.Name: Worst Protocol Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol latency from all active sessions. A user can have >1 sessions concurrently. Keep this number below 180 ms

data.Name: 95th percentile Data Center KPI
data.Tool tips: See "Worst among 95th percentile Connection Servers Performance" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: Worst time taken to load profile
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to load user profile among all the user sessions. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: Worst time taken to Logon
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to login to the desktop among all the user sessions. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: Worst vDisk Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest read or write latency among any of the RDS Host VM virtual disks, measured at 20-second granularity

data.Name: Worst vDisk Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest read or write latency among any of the RDS Host VM virtual disks, measured at 20-second granularity

data.Name: Worst vDisk Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest read or write latency among any of the VM virtual disks, measured at 20-second granularity

data.Name: Worst vCPU Ready
data.Tool tips: See CPU "Highest Usage" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Worst Protocol Receive Packet Loss
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol Received Packet Loss from all active sessions. Keep this number below….?

data.Name: Worst vCPU Usage
data.Tool tips: See CPU "Highest Usage" for template/sample, and adjust accordingly

data.Name: Worst vDisk Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest read or write latency among any of the VM virtual disks, measured at 20-second granularity

data.Name: 95th percentile Network KPI
data.Tool tips: Same formula as Pod. It's derived from Farm and Pool, not Pod

data.Name: App Volumes Manager Servers
data.Tool tips: The number of Horizon App Volume Manager Servers. This should match the documented architecture or plan. If not, either update the documentation or the actual deployment

data.Name: Worst Protocol Transmit Packet Loss
data.Tool tips: Highest Horizon Protocol Transmitted Packet Loss from all active sessions. Keep this number below….?

data.Name: Worst time taken to load profile
data.Tool tips: See "Worst time taken to load profile"

data.Name: Worst time taken to load profile
Worst time taken to Logon
data.Tool tips: The longest time taken to login to the desktop among all users in the VDI Pool. Ensure this number is below the plan.

data.Name: Worst vDisk Latency
data.Tool tips: Highest read or write latency among any of the VM virtual disks, measured at 20-second granularity

data.Name: Worst UAG KPI
data.Tool tips: See "95th percentile Pod Network KPI" for template/example. Follow it

data.Name: Average Utilization
data.Tool tips: The average number of all session's usage
